clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Using Interactive Consulting System to Enhance Decision Aids
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Using Interactive Consulting System Based on Natural Language Processing Technology to Enhance Decision Aids of Cataract Patients: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the performance of an interactive mobile chatbot in recognition of patients' speech and assess its effectiveness for enhancing informed decisions made by cataract patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Cataract surgery is the only way to treat age-related cataract. For patients at early or moderate stages, cataract surgery is an elective surgery without objective indications. Therefore thee patients are uaually not aware whether they should receive the surgery. In clinical practice, traditional Patient Decision Aids (PDAs) booklets are used to provide health education to patients. However, PDAs lack real-time interaction with patients, and are unable to answer the new questions raised. As a result, many patients still have doubts about whether they should receive cataract surgery or not. In this study, we aim to assess the effectiveness of an interactive Q&A mobile application based on natural language processing technology to enhance informed decisions made by cataract patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Informed choice about cataract surgery (the proportion of participants who make an informed choiceï¼Œwhich is defined as a good knowledge score and an intention that is consistent with their attitude score)
primary_outcome.description: Informed choice is an aggregated measure of multiple measurements, including knowledge (a 12-item questionnaire that assesses conceptual (items 1-10) and numerical (items 11-12) knowledge), attitudes (6 items, with 5 responses for each), and intentions (single item with 5 responses)

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of speech recognition by the Interactive Consulting System
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after speech data sent to the server and processed
secondary_outcome.description: The researchers will manually check the content of patients' speech and that generated after speech recognition by the mobile application

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (1)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who could read the information all the way through

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (2)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who agree that the information is new

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (3)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who agree that the length is just about right

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (4)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who think the information is balanced

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (5)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who agree that the Interactive Consulting System is clear and easy to understand

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (6)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who find the information helpful

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization and acceptability of the Interactive Consulting System (7)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who feel it worth recommending to others

arm_group.description: A chatbot of patient decision aid embedded into a mobile application which is able to bidirectionally interact with patients and provide standard general information, quantitative risk information on the possible outcomes of cataract surgery.
